articles.author: Tom Bateman, Mariko Katsumura
articles.description: Japan's revered Mount Fuji finally regained an iconic snowcap on Thursday, setting a record for the slowest snowfall in 130 years, the meteorological agency said.
articles.title: Snowcap on Japan's Mt Fuji this year is latest spotted in 130 years

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Joseph Ax, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden was set to address the nation on Thursday after a stinging election defeat for his Democratic Party at the hands of Republican Donald Trump, whose stunning political comeback has reverberated around the world.
articles.title: Biden set to address nation after Trump's decisive U.S. election win

articles.author: Josh Smith
articles.description: Donald Trump has long touted his relationship with Kim Jong Un, but if the U.S. president-elect seeks another summit he will find a North Korean leader emboldened by an expanded missile arsenal and a much closer relationship with Russia.
articles.title: Years after historic summits, Trump faces an emboldened North Korea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck said on Thursday that Chancellor Olaf Scholz was right to fire the finance minister, spelling an end to the coalition government, and insisted that Germany was still capable of functioning.
articles.title: Germany still capable of functioning, economy minister says

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Australia Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Thursday the government would legislate for a ban on social media for children under 16, a policy the government says is world-leading.
articles.title: Australia proposes ban on social media for those under 16

articles.author: Yoshifumi Takemoto, Yukiko Toyoda, Tim Kelly
articles.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba hopes to meet U.S. President-elect Donald Trump in the United States this month, four sources said, in an attempt to emulate then-Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's close ties during Trump's first term.
articles.title: Japan PM Ishiba seeks meeting with Trump this month, following Abe example

articles.author: Greg Torode, Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump inherits a United States-China relationship reset by presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping over the last year to lift ties off a diplomatic nadir after COVID-19 and tension over Taiwan.
articles.title: Explainer: China-U.S. talks on critical issues under threat as new Trump era looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mozambican police fired tear gas at hundreds of opposition supporters converging on the capital Maputo on Thursday for the biggest demonstration yet against last month's disputed election.
articles.title: Mozambique police fire tear gas as opposition supporters march on capital

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Security Council Secretary Sergei Shoigu, a powerful ally of President Vladimir Putin, said on Thursday that the West should accept that Russia was winning the Ukraine war and negotiate an end to the conflict.
articles.title: Russia's Shoigu says West should negotiate end to Ukraine war based on current realities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The strengthening ties between Russia and North Korea are not only a threat to European security, but also for the United States, NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte said on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea-Russia ties are also a threat to US security, NATO chief says
